clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of Non-pharmacological Insomnia Therapy in People Living With HIV

brief_summary.textblock: To establish with a prospective randomized placebo-controlled study the feasibility of allied-health personnel-administered cognitive behavioral insomnia therapy (CBTI) as a means of improving HIV/AIDS treatment adherence.

primary_outcome.description: Patients evaluated weekly for change in sleep efficiency.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated once weekly for changes in medication adherence.
Changes in reported fatigue levels measured weekly, via the Paper Fatigue Scale (PFS), and the HIV-Related Fatigue Scale (HRFS).
